question: My father has Type II diabetes.  I was diagonosed as pre-diabetic a year ago and while I've tested under 100 for two doctor visits, and am not longer considered pre-diabetic, in monitoring myself, I find lately I'm over 100 a couple times a week.  My diet is excellent--I'm very careful..  Two things.  This morning I woke up with a 110 reading and wonder if the D-Mannnose and Cranberry tablets I'm taking for urinary tract discomfort has affected that reading. Secondly, when I returned from an intensive 2-hour hike an hour ago my reading was 102.  Now it's 116. ( I ate a high fiber cereal and cherries for breakfast before the hike.)  Shouldn't my levels be heading lower an hour after this hike--not higher?Cinney
title: Rising glucose levels an hour after exercising
